alert.note: Alert for Butler (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 17 at 11:09AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 AM CDT FOR ELK...EASTERN COWLEY...SOUTHEASTERN BUTLER...NORTHERN CHAUTAUQUA AND SOUTHWESTERN GREENWOOD COUNTIES... At 1109 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Severy to 5 miles east of Burden, moving southeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Howard, Cedar Vale, Burden, Moline, Longton, Dexter, Severy, Grenola, Atlanta, Fall River, Latham, Elk Falls, Cambridge, Climax, Maple City, Beaumont, Piedmont, Fall River Lake and Fall River State Park. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
